data.title: Fonts in the Fallout series
data.meta_description: The fonts in the Fallout series are used both in and out of the game for tone consistency, visual branding, and promotional imagery. User interface fonts are packaged with the game and are used to display text for the player to read. In-game fonts are used within the game world on sprites. Fonts...
data.text:
The fonts in the Fallout series are used both in and out of the game for tone consistency, visual branding, and promotional imagery.

Fallout and Fallout 2 fonts[]

User Interface[]

User interface fonts are packaged with the game and are used to display text for the player to read.

Font Name Image Description Example Gothic 821 Condensed A thick, upper and lower-case font. Based on Berthold Block first made in 1908, Gothic 821 Condensed is a derivative font created in 1993. In Fallout and Fallout 2, it is used as the title font for the intro sequences as well as the UI, such as for the tab font, skilldex menu, and the Tell me about feature in Fallout.

• Gothic 821 Condensed on Wikipedia

• Gothic 821 in use JH Fallout A thin, upper and lower-case futuristic font. Made for Fallout in 1997. Used for all monochrome text.

• Available for free from No Mutants Allowed Futura A geometric and thin, upper and lower-case sans-serif font first created in 1927. Futura is used in multiple areas: the inventory "DONE" button, "TOWN WORLD" button, and the Poseidon Gasoline map logo.

• Futura on Wikipedia

• Futura in use Brush Script A cursive, upper and lower-case font originally created in 1942. Used for the logotype of the Pip-Boy 2000.

• Brush Script on Wikipedia

• Brush Script in use Gill Sans Extra Condensed Bold A humanist sans-serif font apart of the Gill Sans family introduced in 1926, Extra Condensed Bold was later created in 1937. Used for displaying the perk names in the character selection menu.

• Gill Sans on Wikipedia

• Gill Sans Nova Extra Condensed Bold in use Microgramma A wide sans-serif font introduced in 1952. Used for the "Skilldex" button tape.

• Microgramma on Wikipedia

• Microgramma in use

In-game[]

In-game fonts are used within the game world on sprites.

Font Name Image Description Example Arial Black A monotype font originally created in 1982. Used for the intro slide show of Fallout 2.

• Arial on Wikipedia

• Arial in use Brush Script A cursive, upper and lower-case font originally created in 1942. Used for the branding of Nuka-Cola and the Garden of Eden Creation Kit.

• Brush Script on Wikipedia

• Brush Script in use Futura A geometric and thin, upper and lower-case sans-serif font first created in 1927. Futura Heavy used on the Boneyard loading screen for the Poseidon Gasoline logo and the rest of the type. The Only Shadow variant of Futura used on The Hub location screen.

• Futura on Wikipedia

• Futura in use Gil Sans A monotype based on a font from 1913, Gil Sans was released in 1928. Composed of bold upper and lower case letters. Used on the logotype for Pep Gas.

• Gill Sans on Wikipedia

• Gil Sans in use Impact A thick, upper and lower-case industrial font made in 1965.

• Impact on Wikipedia

• Futura in use Stencil Bold A thick, upper and lower-case font made in 1937 to emulate a sprayed stencil sign.

• Stencil on Wikipedia

• Stencil in use Comic Sans A casual script font made in 1994.

• Comic Sans on Wikipedia

• Comic Sans in use Akzidenz Grotesk BE Light Extended Font A upper and lower case grotesk style font first made in 1898, the font was expanded with a variety of style in the 50s and 60s by the company that first produced it.

• Akzidenz-Grotesk

• Akzikdenz Grotesk in use

External branding[]

Fonts used for box art, marketing, and other advertisements related to Fallout and Fallout 2.

Font Name Image Description Example Univers 59 Condensed Part of a large font family created in 1957, Univers 59 condensed was used for the boxart logo after being heavily modified, with the "o" being stylized.

• Univers family on Wikipedia

• Univers in use Swiss 911 A tall and condensed, upper and lower-case font. Based on Helvetica Compressed first made in 1957, Swiss 911 is a derivative font created in the 80s. Italicized for "A Post-Nuclear Role Playing Game" on the Fallout and Fallout 2 logos.

• Swiss 911 in use OCR-A A utilitarian, sans-serif font originally created in 1968 to be read by both computers and humans. This font was used by Interplay's marketing department and not used by the dev team, which wasn't consulted about the design of the promotional artwork.

• OCR-A on Wikipedia

• Brush Script in use Futura A geometric and thin, upper and lower-case sans-serif font first created in 1927. Bold and thin fonts used for the Vault Dweller's Survival Guide.

• Futura on Wikipedia

• Futura in use

Fallout 3 and Fallout: New Vegas[]

User Interface[]

Font Name Image Description Example Gothic 821 Condensed A thick, upper and lower-case font. Based on Berthold Block first made in 1908, Gothic 821 Condensed is a derivative font created in 1993. In Fallout: New Vegas, it is used as the title font for the add-on intro sequences. Monofonto A technical, monospaced sans serif font originally created in 1999. Used ubiquitously in the game's UI. Fixedsys Default font used for all terminals.

Fixedsys on Wikipedia

In-game[]

Font Name Image Description Example Gillies Gothic Bold A smooth, sans-serif typeface.

Gillies Gothic Bold on Fontsgeek

Kabel Bold A geometric, sans-setif typeface designed by Rudolf Koch and released in 1927.

Wikipedia

Chowderhead A serif typeface designed by Stuart Sandler.

MyFonts

Singlesville Script Classic retro brush-style sans-serif script by Stuart Sandler.

MyFonts

Swing

MyFonts

Swanky A retro latin serif font, designed to evoke the Atomic Age.

1001 Fonts

Mirage Zanzibar A retro typeface designed by Brian Bonislawsky and Stuart Sandler, released in 2002.

MyFonts

Birds of Paradise A modern adaptation of Al Elliot's 1975 font.

DaFont

Vivaldi An elegant script typeface designed by Fritz Peters in 1970.

Microsoft

Rosewood Std Regular A typeface design based on Clarendon letterforms (1866 to 1875). This one is Adobe corporation's version, released in 1994, and specifically based on William Page's 1874 typeface.

Dafont

Black Hawk A western-style serif typeface.

DaFont

Florida Project A sans-serif font.

DaFont

Freestyle Script Informal script typeface designed by Colin Brignall in 1969 and Martin Wait in 1981.

Freestyle Script on Wikipedia

PLATSCH A retro sans-serif typeface.

Fontspace

Oklahoma A Western-style serif typeface.

Allfont

US 101 A simple sans-serif font.

DaFont

Postino A quirky type derived from the Courier typeface by Tim Donaldson.

MyFonts

LD Wanted A blocky Western-style serif font, resembling woodcut letters.

MyFonts

Utopia Black Headline A variant of the Utopia text face designed by Robert Slimbach in 1989, for Adobe.

MyFonts

Smilage A retro, 50s style sans serif typeface.

Fontspace

DIN A font family designed by Albert-Jan Pool starting in 1995.

MyFonts

Cheap Motel A decorative sans-serif font.

FontSpace

Scream A blocky, sans-serif font.

Fontzillion

Pecot A serif font by Graham Meade.

Homepage

Speedline Regular

Fontsgeek

Mister Television by Font Diner

MyFonts

Arial A monotype font originally created in 1982. Used for signage in Fallout: New Vegas.

• Arial on Wikipedia

• Arial in use Arial Black A monotype font originally created in 1982. Used for signage in Fallout: New Vegas.

• Arial on Wikipedia

• Arial in use EDO

DaFont

Plastic Display A display, sans-serif typeface.

Fontspring

Nevada State Lotto top font Brush Script A cursive, upper and lower-case font originally created in 1942. Used for the branding of Nuka-Cola and the Garden of Eden Creation Kit.

• Brush Script on Wikipedia

• Brush Script in use Courier A thin font specifically created for computers in 1955.

• Courier on Wikipedia

• Courier in use Baveuse A stylized 60s-like font first released in 2005.

• DaFont

• Baveuse in use Comic Sans A casual script font made in 1994.

• Comic Sans on Wikipedia

• Comic Sans in use Gil Sans A monotype based on a font from 1913, Gil Sans was released in 1928. Composed of bold upper and lower case letters. Used on the logotype BlamCo and their product BlamCo Mac & Cheese.

• Gill Sans on Wikipedia

• Gil Sans in use Wide Glide A wide italicized slab-serif connected font created in 1997. Used as the logotype for the Pip-Boy 3000. Papyrus A tall themed font meant to invoke ancient writing style that was first created in 1982. Used as the logotype for the Pip-Boy 3000.

• Papyrus on Wikipedia

• Papyrus in use Lithograph Bold A cartoony and exaggerated shaped font. Used for the welcome sign of Cottonwood Cove. Pecot Bold A tall bold font with subtle curves. Used for the logotype of Saturnite. Market Deco A thin art deco font. Used for the emblem of the Ballistic Defense Division.

DaFont

SF Americana Dreams Extended Retro underline connected angular font created in 2005. Used for the Protecto glasses.

DaFont

Add City Boy Retro blocky font created in 2005. Used for the Radiation King logotype and Nuka-Cola Quantum (Fallout 3) logo.

DaFont

External branding[]

Fallout 4 and Fallout 76[]

User Interface[]

Font Name Image Description Example Roboto

Wikipedia

Fallout 4 UI font Sharetech Mono

Google Fonts

Terminal text font

In-game[]

External branding[]

Font Name Image Description Example Wide Glide A wide italicized slab-serif connected font created in 1997. Used as the logotype for the Pip-Boy on the Pip-Boy Operational Instructions manual.

Notes[]

Codsworth can tell the Sole Survivor a joke about the fonts Papyrus, Arial, and Comic Sans. These fonts were made in 1982, 1984, and 1994, respectively, and have all been used in-universe.[1]
